file_content.text: If you have any other questions, you can address the young lady directly.
Ah, you must be here for Officer Sakoal's wife. He said to expect you.
One moment.
Gann doesn't usually go out of his way to see me protected. Is this going to be so dangerous?
Or are you really just my chaperone?
I've never been much for staying out of trouble.
I'd make a poor chaperone.
Funny, Gann's got a thing for that type.
He can't stop us from looking, can he?
Do you need one?
Depends what you're asking to look at....
You're a married woman. You should observe the bounds of propriety.
I'm meant to keep you in line.
Well, pardon me. You going to make sure I eat with the right fork, too?
I can't remember the last time he voluntarily let me spend time with a man who wasn't stodgy or senile.
The war hasn't threatened the Imperial outpost yet.
You'll be safe.
But there's still all these curfews and checkpoints and... argh! I could just scream. Who lives in a place like this?
Start walking. We've got no reason to chat.
Enough small talk.
Sorry.
Maybe Officer Sakoal is just worried about you.
Your husband's being careful.
Worried about his property, maybe. If he cared about me, I'd see him more than just on the comlink, you know?
Let's get going.
